title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Officer Scott MacIsaac, an active-duty Boston police officer, died from cancer on Friday after being diagnosed in 2025.
MacIsaac joined the Boston Police Department in 1995 and served in West Roxbury for the last 6 years.
He received commendations for his actions during the Boston Marathon bombings and other life-saving incidents.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Jeremy Swayman and Lightning's Andrei Vasilevskiy engaged in a goalie fight during a Stadium Series game in Tampa.
The fight occurred after a confrontation involving Lightning forward Brandon Hagel and Bruins' Charlie McAvoy, leading to goalie tensions.
Both goalies received penalties but remained in the game, with Swayman recording 41 saves in Boston's 6-5 shootout loss.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, charged with murder after fatal shooting of Elizabeth and Nicholas Almeida in Fall River.
Elizabeth and Nicholas Almeida were found shot on Barnes Street, and pronounced dead at a local hospital.
Cole, dating Elizabeth Almeida, faced with two murder counts and firearm possession, to be arraigned Monday.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 skiers were rescued from a malfunctioning ski lift at Dartmouth Skiway in Lyme Center, N.H.
Rescue involved fire departments from Lyme, Hanover, and Thetford, assisted by police from Lyme and Orford.
One skier was hospitalized, while others were examined and returned to the main lodge for warmth.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dean Tran, 50, receives 11-month federal prison sentence, mostly concurrent with existing 18-month sentence for fraud charges.
Tran pled guilty to obstruction and false statement charges after lying about authorship of a pandemic unemployment letter.
Tran's legal issues include state ethics violations and previous charges of theft, gun intimidation, and misleading investigators.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten of the Boston Bruins named NHL Rookie of the Month for January after scoring eight goals.
Minten contributed to Boston's impressive 11-2-1 record in January, leading NHL rookies with 14 points.
Acquired from the Maple Leafs in 2025, Minten is Boston's first Rookie of the Month since Jeremy Swayman in 2022.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Seven crew members are presumed dead after the Lily Jean fishing vessel sank near Gloucester on Friday.
The U.S. Coast Guard suspended its search after covering 1,000 square miles with no additional survivors found.
Victims include Gloucester captain Gus Sanfilippo, father Sean Therrien, Salem native John Rousanidis, and Virginia observer Jada Samitt.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins players dressed as colonial-era Patriots for their Stadium Series game in Tampa.
The team's costumes paid homage to both the historical ties of Boston and the New England Patriots.
Bruins sourced outfits from Boston Costume, allowing players to design unique pregame attire.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Red Sox are reportedly trading pitcher Jordan Hicks and prospect David Sandlin to the White Sox.
In return, Boston is acquiring minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl and will send additional cash to Chicago.
Hicks struggled in 2025 with an 8.20 ERA and is set to earn $12.5 million in 2026.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Boston.com's Ben Stas photographed Day 1 of Something in the Way festival at Roadrunner.
The festival featured two dozen indie bands including The Hotelier and Angel Du$t.
Day 1 performers included Her New Knife, Graham Hunt, and Explosions in the Sky.
